evaluation_table.reasoning: Both documents specify the same software version.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: last non-missing value prior to the first infusion
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: last non-missing observation (including central laboratory results, vital signs, and tumor assessments) recorded prior to the First Dose Date

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: EOT and unscheduled visit will not be summarized in visit-based tables, unless otherwise indicated.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Data collected at the EOT visit will be mapped to the appropriate cycle window based on the Study Day of the assessment
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP explicitly excludes EOT from visit-based summaries by default. Generated SAP explicitly includes EOT data by mapping it to cycle windows.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: EOT and unscheduled visit will not be summarized in visit-based tables, unless otherwise indicated.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Data from unscheduled visits will be included in the windowing process and may be used as the analyzed value for a visit

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Listings will be sorted by the treatment group and then patient number
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: All data collected will be listed by patient, treatment, and visit
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP sorts by Treatment then Patient. Generated SAP sorts by Patient then Treatment.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Missing values in ORR will be considered as 'Non-responder'
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Patients with no post-baseline tumor assessment or whose response cannot be evaluated (NE) will be treated as non-responders
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both specify non-responder imputation for missing primary endpoint data.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: stratified by country, sex (female vs. male), disease status (recurrence vs. metastatic), ECOG performance status (0 vs. 1)
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: stratification factors: sex (female vs. male), disease status (recurrence vs. metastatic), and ECOG performance score (0 vs. 1). Country will be included as a covariate
evaluation_table.protocol_text: stratified by country, sex (female vs. male), disease status (recurrence vs. metastatic), and ECOG performance score (0 vs. 1)
evaluation_table.reasoning: Factors match. Both documents mention pooling country if sparse.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: two-sided test with an overall level of significance (alpha) of 0.05... corresponds to two one-sided tests (TOST) each at the 0.025

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: double-blinded... unblinded for the 1st CSR for a reporting purpose... remain blinded to the investigators and patients until study termination
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: unblinded to pre-defined personnel... for reporting purposes... remain blinded to the investigators, patients... until the end of the study
evaluation_table.protocol_text: unblinded... after the completion of Cycle 6... for the reporting purposes
evaluation_table.reasoning: Blinding procedures and unblinding for reporting match.

extra_information_flagged.detail: Added as a sensitivity analysis not present in Original SAP.
extra_information_flagged.reasoning: Original SAP uses Tipping Point. Generated SAP adds Complete Case.

reasoning: The Generated SAP is missing a significant amount of specific general methodology details found in the Original SAP, including decimal precision rules, sample size calculations, randomization details, and the specific Tipping Point sensitivity analysis for missing data. It also contradicts the Original SAP on the handling of EOT and Unscheduled visits (Original excludes, Generated includes via windowing) and listing sort order. While the core statistical approach (Logistic Regression, Non-responder imputation) matches, the lack of detail and the methodological contradictions regarding visit handling lower the quality.
summary: The Generated SAP misses substantial general methodology details, including decimal precision rules, sample size calculations, and the required Tipping Point sensitivity analysis. It also contradicts the Original SAP regarding the handling of EOT and unscheduled visit data in summaries and listing sort orders.
